feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 6:35PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Near Jordan Creek. * WHEN...Until 630 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Through Alaska Range Passes Late Tuesday Night and Wednesday... South winds gusting over 50 mph are expected through Alaska Range Passes after midnight Tuesday night through Wednesday. The strongest winds will be near Healy, and south of of Delta Junction.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... The northwest Interior received 2 to 5 inches of rainfall over the past week, with the heaviest amounts in the Upper Kobuk, Upper Noatak, and lower Koyukuk Valleys. Expect rivers in the Noatak, Kobuk and Koyukuk Valleys to remain high this week. Flooding is not expected, but most gravel bars will be covered by water, and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia today will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Tuesday, and into the Interior by Wednesday. This will bring south winds of 25 to 40 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday that will decrease slowly Tue night and Wed.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND... A series of atmospheric rivers will move across the northern half of Southeast Alaska starting early Thursday near Yakutat and then sliding over the northern inner channels through Friday. While there are uncertainties on the timing and track of additional rainfall for the weekend, rain amounts of 2 to 7 inches is expected with the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 29 at 9:34AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA TUESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Tuesday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 29 at 1:55PM PDT until August 30 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 100 expected. * WHERE...In Oregon, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Oregon. In Washington, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 9 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 29 at 1:55PM PDT until August 31 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures of 97 to 103 expected. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon. In Washington, Kittitas Valley, Yakima Valley and Lower Columbia Basin of Washington. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 8 PM PDT Wednesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kittitas Valley; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington; Yakima Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 11:29PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Kanawha County through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marmet, or near Charleston, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
